body_html:
You have to set the model_dir, eg. if you want to store the outputs in ./output folder:

estimator = tf.contrib.learn.LinearRegressor(feature_columns=features, model_dir='./output')

Same thing if you follow the next example (Custom model):

estimator = tf.contrib.learn.Estimator(model_fn=model,model_dir='./output')

Then you can use TensorBoard to show the result:
>tensorboard --logdir=output
body_text:
You have to set the model_dir, eg. if you want to store the outputs in ./output folder:
estimator = tf.contrib.learn.LinearRegressor(feature_columns=features, model_dir='./output')
Same thing if you follow the next example (Custom model):
estimator = tf.contrib.learn.Estimator(model_fn=model,model_dir='./output')
Then you can use TensorBoard to show the result:
>tensorboard --logdir=output
body: You have to set the `model_dir`, eg. if you want to store the outputs in `./output `folder: `estimator = tf.contrib.learn.LinearRegressor(feature_columns=features, model_dir='./output')` Same thing if you follow the next example (Custom model): `estimator = tf.contrib.learn.Estimator(model_fn=model,model_dir='./output')` Then you can use TensorBoard to show the result: `>tensorboard --logdir=output`
